quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Delaware and Guatemala
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, nicknames. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these nicknames refers to the U.S. state of Delaware?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First State

questions.question: The 1961 movie musical West Side Story was loosely based on which famous play by William Shakespeare?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romeo and Juliet

questions.question: What is the state beverage of the U.S state of Delaware?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milk

questions.question: What celebrated movie star portrayed Vicki Lester in the 1954 movie musical A Star Is Born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judy Garland

questions.question: Who performed the 1967 hit song Baby I Love You?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aretha Franklin

questions.question: Who recorded the 2000 song Come On Over Baby (All I Want Is You)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christina Aguilera

questions.question: What actor portrayed Nick Arnstein in the 1968 musical movie Funny Girl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Omar Sharif

questions.question: The U.S. state of Delaware was named after which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: British nobleman

questions.question: Which of these famous actors was born in the U.S. state of Delaware?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The national motto of Guatemala is Libre Crezca Fecundo. What does iy mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Live Free and Fertile

questions.question: Which of these natural disasters are typical of Guatemala?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What group originally recorded the 1963 song Be My Baby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ronettes

questions.question: What does the word maribma, which is associated with the culture of Guatemala, denote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Musical instrument

questions.question: What artist released the song Bye Bye Baby in 1993?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madonna

questions.question: What popular band performed the 2001 hit song Hey Baby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No Doubt

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Kate Winslet and Delaware
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, deity, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Actress Kate Winslet made her first TV appearance in a commercial advertising what kind of product?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Breakfast cereal

questions.question: Trivia was the Roman deity of which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Witchcraft

questions.question: What name did actress Kate Winslet give to her daughter, born in 2000?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mia Honey

questions.question: What did Kate Winslet began studying in Redroofs Theatre School at the age of 11?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drama

questions.question: Kate Winslet and her second husband, director Sam Mendes have agreed upon which of the following?

options.text: Never to work together on a movie project
Never to fly together in the same airplane
Never to wear same color outfits

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Never to fly together in the same airplane

questions.question: In Roman mythology, the goddess Carmenta is a protector of which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Childbirth

questions.question: What is the state capital of the U.S. state of Delaware?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dover

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning actress portrayed Angelique in Bob Fosses 1979 musical movie All That Jazz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jessica Lange

questions.question: In what country was actress Kate Winslet born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: Name the 1956 movie musical directed by Walter Lang and based on the book Anna and the King of Siam by Margaret Landon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The King and I

questions.question: In which sport are the Delaware Destroyers sports team competing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Basketball

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the U.S. state of Delaware?

options.text: It is the second-smallest U.S. state by territory.
It is the least populous U.S. state.
It is the most densely-populated U.S. state.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the second-smallest U.S. state by territory.

questions.question: What is the state flower of the U.S. state of Delaware?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peach blossom

questions.question: Which of these became the first animated movie to be nominated for the Best Picture Oscar, and the only animated movie to be included in the list of the greatest movie musicals by the American Film Institute?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beauty and the Beast

questions.question: The Roman god Uranus is associated with which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sky

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Winona Ryder and Kate Winslet
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: From what country did Winona Ryders grandparents emigrate to the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russia

questions.question: What was actress Winona Ryder named after?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A city

questions.question: This Oscar-winning actress and Winona Ryder were once roommates and close friends, but they reportedly grew apart because of a movie role.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gwyneth Paltrow

questions.question: Kate Winslet and Leonardo DiCaprio had a brief romantic affair after the filming of Titanic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who is the Roman god of fire and volcanoes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vulcan

questions.question: What kind of phobia did actress Winona Ryder develop when she was twelve?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fear of water

questions.question: What is the name of the Roman goddess of luck and fate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fortuna

questions.question: What is the name of the character portrayed by Kate Winslet in the 1997 blockbuster Titanic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose

questions.question: For which of the following did actress Winona Ryder offer a $200,000 reward in 1993?

options.text: The return of a stolen dog of a rare breed
The return of a stolen pair of earrings that belonged to her grandmother
The return of a kidnapped child

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The return of a kidnapped child

questions.question: To which Academy Award-nominated actor was Winona Ryder engaged from 1990 to 1993?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Depp

questions.question: Kate Winslet received her first Academy Award for her role in this movie.

options.text: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Reader

questions.question: Why was Winona Ryder bullied at school when she was a child?

options.text: Her feet were too big for her tiny frame.
The other kids believed she was a boy wearing girlish clothes.
She suffered from a heavy stutter.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The other kids believed she was a boy wearing girlish clothes.

questions.question: In Roman mythology, Bona Dea is the goddess of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What movie earned actress Winona Ryder her first Academy Award nomination?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Age of Innocence

questions.question: What is the name of the Roman God of war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Mice and Following
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who first popularized New York Citys famous nickname The Big Apple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A journalist

questions.question: Which New York City borough is the largest in area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queens

questions.question: Naturally, or in the wild, all mice species are classified as which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbivores

questions.question: Which of these describes best the plot of the 1946 movie Its a Wonderful Life?

options.text: An angel stops a man from committing suicide.
A woman dies in a crash and comes back as a dove.
A child wakes up a grown man falls in love with a friend of his mother.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An angel stops a man from committing suicide.

questions.question: What does the term knockout mouse denote?

options.text: A very aggressive mouse which defends its territory by all means, and even attacks humans
A mouse whose genes have been selectively turned off
A mouse that is used in military operations

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A mouse whose genes have been selectively turned off

questions.question: What happens to 13-year-old Josh Baskin in the 1988 fantasy movie Big?

options.text: He wakes up a grown man.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He wakes up a grown man.

questions.question: Mice have excellent vision.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What comedian and actor starred in the 1993 fantasy-comedy movie Groundhog Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Murray

questions.question: The shape of what animal has the pooka Harvey acquired in the 1950 movie Harvey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rabbit

questions.question: Mice are known to be repelled by which of the following scents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Artificial fruit scent

questions.question: Which of these famous people was born in New York City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Mice communicate through pheromones which are contained in which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following is not true about mice in general?

options.text: Mice often vomit food they are unable to digest and chew it all over again.
Unlike other rodents, they do not eat their droppings.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Mice do not use their tails for which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In fights

questions.question: House mice have not one, but two of which of the following organs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thymus

options.text: To invent a medicine that will cure most contemporary diseases

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Garlic and Francis Ford Coppola
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, ford. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 1984 crime movie, directed by Francis Ford Coppola and starring Richard Gere, centered on a popular 1930s jazz club in Harlem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cotton Club

questions.question: Francis Ford Coppola co-directed the 1989 movie New York Stories together with what celebrated film director?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Scorsese

questions.question: Garlic is rich in what important vitamin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin B6

questions.question: The 1997 movie The Rainmaker, directed by Francis Ford Coppola, was based on the novel of the same by which celebrated author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Grisham

questions.question: Garlic is an aphrodisiac.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The consumption of garlic causes halitosis, or non-bacterial bad breath. The consumption of which of the following is recommended to avoid or tone down the condition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parsley

questions.question: What effect does the consumption of garlic produce on the blood of humans?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lowers the blood sugar levels

questions.question: What is the scientific term for the morbid fear of garlic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alliumphobia

questions.question: The pungent odor and biting taste of garlic are caused by which of the following chemical elements?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sulfur

questions.question: Garlic is recommended in which of the following cases?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In what religion is the consumption of garlic and onions considered improper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hinduism

questions.question: Which of these actors did not appear in Francis Ford Coppolas 1986 movie Peggy Sue Got Married?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Nicholson

questions.question: Garlic and onions are considered toxic for which animals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cats and dogs

questions.question: For which of these movies did Francis Ford Coppola receive his first Academy Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Godfather

questions.question: What is the title of the 1992 horror movie based on the novel Dracula by Bram Stoker, and directed by Francis Ford Coppola?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dracula
